item.description:
Hi Everyone,

Looks like the weather will be identaical to Saturday in many ways..


I STILL SEE WINDS PREDICTED IN THE 5-10 MPH RANGE BUT WARMER TEMPS..IM TEMPTED BUT NOT WILING TO HAVE A SADDENING EXPERIENCE ON THE OCEAN, ITS JUST NOT ENJOYABLE IN THE WIND..although the wind may be actually less tomorrow, a few people wrote to me indicating the sound was smoothe..not taking any chances...remember Mystic and Circle Beach, no one wanted to go through the wind to the deep..LOL
Predictions then were less than 8 mph..
I can only go by the predictions and make a decision based on the current weather report at the time of posting, besides its a mixed group of recreationals and sea yaks along with different skills..
Oh well... im gonna pick and live with my choices.. Join me if you want to..




TO BE SAFE AND EASIER ON EVERYONE, I CHOSE SALMON COVE AND SALMON RIVER ALL THE WAY UP TO THE DAMM DAM FOR A TRIP, WE CAN STOP AND CHECK OUT THE OLD SUNRIZE RESORT ON THE WAY.

That spot also seems to be a good snack/Lunch location.

The best way to get to this PUT IN location by SALMON COVE is by using the same directions to GOODSPEED OPRAH HOUSE,

For GPS use 117 East Haddam Moodus Road, East Haddam,
The Meetup Map link above is correct.

Getting There, From Hartford, The meetup map link above seems to be accurate enough.
take I-91 south: take Exit 22s. (left hand exit) = Route 9 South , take Exit 7, (rte 82 to the Goodspeed Oprah House.

At the end of the exit ramp take a left onto Middlesex tpk=rte 154 for a few hundred feet then back onto rte 82 east, cross the river and pass the oprah house and slow down.

Take a left onto rte 149 at the Gelston House.

The State boat ramp sign and road is 1 mile north of the left you made at the Opra House..



THE Pot Luck Barbie-Q AFTER PARTY MAYBEE....WE DECIDE AT THE END OF THE PADDLE EVENT,

I WILL LOAD THE GRILL ANYWAY AND SOME FOOD.

I think Hurd park is a perfect spot for a gathering only because its close and no need to worry about ANYTHING..LOL but since its sunday we might just go home if its too late...lets see..




Directions to Hurd State Park:


From Boat ramp Road,

Take a left onto rte 149 north

Go to rte 609= Leesville rd

then left (really keep straight) onto rte 151


Keep going to the intersection of 151/Hog Hill Road/Hurd Park Road,
Take a sharp left onto Hurd Park Road, go apx 0.75 miles then the main park entrance is on the right,
Follow the paved road apx 0.75 miles then there is a sign that says BALL field and SHELTER,
take that right and go to end,
we will be at the shelter at one of the fireplaces.

..BRING SOME WOOD..YOUR CHAIRS, ....bugg juice and food..LOL







Kayaks available: Paddle & PDF with whistle included,

Dougnation of 15 bucks for the kayak rented for this particular event.

Please make sure you are familiar with the yak you choose.

I will only bring the yaks that are confirmed by a yes and by persons i have some familiarity with..
Sorry i don't like to leave un-attended yaks on the trailer.

The Blonde Necky Fiberglass Eliza. Short Sea Kayak 16 feet, 40 lbs = ????

The Brown Homeless Bathtub, Recreational Kayak= Pungo 12' with F/R floataion bags installed=

The Blue Flipper & Dipper, Sea Kayak= Riot Tourlite 15'=

The Yellow Bananna Snake, Sea Kayak= Cobra Expidition SOT 18', =

The Red Wild Dancer, Sea Kayak= Eddyline Wind Dancer 18'=

The Red Flat Boat, Sea Kayak= NDK Greenlander Pro 18'=

See you all there..
al-r
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the orange cones and ORANGE HAT

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: Salmon Cove and River Paddle trip
